channel.title: FinTech Feed
channel.description: This feed is responsible for generating the rss feed related to the topic fintech

item.title: Exploring the Next Frontier of NFTs
item.description: The market crash for high-priced NFTs is coming. Given the over-inflation in the market, it would not be a surprise if the high-priced, highly speculative NFTs lost 90% of their value in a matter of weeks.
item.creator: Guest Contributors

item.title: Co-Ops: The Grandparent of DAOs
item.description: Initiated by a few Twitter users with a substantial follower base, a group of internet strangers came together last November attempting to purchase a rare copy of the US Constitution in an auction organized by Sotheby's.
item.creator: Guest Contributors

item.title: Unicorn startups doubled in number in 2021 fintechs took centre stage
item.description: In this report, we highlight the countries and industries that have the highest unicorn startups and valuation, and the distribution of industries that saw new addition of unicorns in 2021. We have focused on fintechs to identify the leading sub-segments and geographies both by t
item.creator: Tellimer

item.title: CBDCS and DeFi:  The Future of Stablecoins
item.description: Over the past two years, DeFi(decentralized finance) applications have ushered in a revolution regarding how we collectively view and interact with money, creating a democratized and transparent financial playing field for all.
item.creator: Guest Contributors

item.title: The top 10 crypto trends
item.description: Cryptocurrencies have really hit the mainstream this year. According to the Global Crypto Adoption Index released by Chainalysis, worldwide adoption of cryptocurrencies jumped by over 880% yoy in August this year, with the most rapid adoption rates seen in emerging markets. This
item.creator: Tellimer

item.title: The Rise of Women in Investing: A Seismic Step Forward
item.description: According to data, 67% of women are now investing their savings in the stock market. This represents a significant 50% increase in the volume of female investors active in 2018.
item.creator: Dmytro Spilka

item.title: The Journey to Digital Member Services
item.description: In this interview, David Lawn, Vice President and Head of North American Client Services at Nasdaq, discusses how Nasdaq digitalization journey started and the vision moving forward.
item.creator: MarketInsite

item.title: DeFi Is A Frightening Prospect For The Banking Industry, But It Doesn't Have To Be
item.description: Regardless of those opposed to the idea, DeFi technology is booming, reaching a market cap of $133.34 Billion in 2021, and a system that opens up access to finance for millions of people around the world is certainly not 'baloney.'
item.creator: Guest Contributors

item.title: Crypto Needs a New Development Paradigm
item.description: Something is broken in blockchain development. We hear about hacks in crypto all the time, the industry is filled with hastily developed products, and project delays are often expected.
item.creator: Guest Contributors

item.title: It's Time to Take a Closer Look at Your Fixed Income Surveillance
item.description: Regulators have recently called out fixed income as an asset class where firms need to focus their attention. The feedback from regulators demonstrates the need for firms to reexamine their surveillance programs and update them to accommodate the nuances of the asset class.
item.creator: MarketInsite

item.title: Modern Finance is Going Mobile
item.description: In the evolution of technology, across decades and generations, there are expansions of new offerings that create solutions to all sorts of challenges.
item.creator: Guest Contributors

item.title: How Blockchain Tech, Digital Currency and the DeFi/Decentralization Movement are Democratizing Global Access and Increasing Personal Safety
item.description: As the world begins to understand and accept the ideas and forces that underpin the eruption of the digital currency movement, the many benefits of decentralized finance are becoming apparent.
item.creator: Guest Contributors

item.title: PayPal's Market Cap Is Almost Double Goldman Sachs; Why Wall Street Needs to Pay Attention
item.description: PayPal (PYPL), which is only about 24 years old, has surpassed Goldman Sachs (GS), one of the world's largest financial institutions, in terms of market capitalization.
item.creator: Naeem Aslam

item.title: In a Crypto Industry Full of Buzzwords, "Lending" May Just be the Next
item.description: This synergistic energy, brand new to the cryptoverse, has given rise to new ideas, burgeoning partnerships, and perhaps most notably, new buzzwords. So what word will join the list next ending. Here's why.
item.creator: Guest Contributors

item.title: Serving the Unbanked: How Borderless Fintech Can Deliver Global Financial Inclusivity
item.description: While the lack of financial inclusivity is stark across many continents, fintech is evolving to give communities more opportunities to manage their finance and potentially to fight poverty through better wealth management services.
item.creator: Dmytro Spilka

item.title: Can Blockchain Fuel Black Art Sales?
item.description: Today the primary and secondary markets for Black artists work are at all-time highs, driving some of the most closely watched sales in the industry.

item.title: How Blockchain Will Become a Driving Force on Wall Street
item.description: Whilst cryptocurrencies and NFTs have taken center stage in 2021 with Bitcoin repeatedly breaking all-time highs and a non-fungible token taking $91.8 million in auction, blockchain technology continued to evolve away from the limelight.
item.creator: Dmytro Spilka

item.title: Crypto ETFs Could Be Compelling in 2022

item.title: 2021 Has Been a Big Year for Bitcoin: What's Next?

item.title: Decentralized Finance Has A $1.4Bn Problem
item.description: Decentralized Finance is the fastest growing sector of the crypto market. With promises of a consumer-centric, open source, and permissionless financial system that is transparent to all, DeFi stands to change the trajectory of consumer and institutional finance.

item.description: One week into the new year, and a new year has brought new market leadership.

item.title: The 14 Charts That Defined 2021 With Josh Brown and Friends
item.description: For a further look at the 14 trends that made 2021 what it was—and to find out whether New York (Prince Street Pizza) or Chicago (Lou Malnati’s) won the “best pizza” battle—watch the replay below, or read on for highlights.

item.title: Let Tech Help You Include Behavioral Diversity Among Your Metrics
item.description: I’m always attracted to places with an “all are welcome” sign. Still, I’ve yet to see such a sign displayed in a corporate setting – only social and cultural ones.
item.creator: Leon Morales

item.title: Top Advisor Marketing Podcast: 342. Our 7 Biggest Marketing Lessons From 2021 for Financial Advisors
item.description: In this episode, Matt Halloran and Kirk Lowe share their seven biggest marketing lessons from 2021. They turn these lessons into strategies that you can implement in 2022 to create marketing that scales your credibility and attracts ideal clients.
item.creator: Kirk Lowe

item.title: Why Web3's Decentralized Dream Is in the Hands of Its Creators and Consumers
item.description: However, in my view, what happens next isn’t in the hands of the money men and women. Ultimately, whether Web3 can live up to the decentralized dream of its proponents or as Dorsey suggests, be controlled by institutional vested interest, will depend on us.
item.creator: Guest Contributors

item.title: Who Led the Patent Race in 2021?
item.description: Here’s an overview of the patent landscape in 2021 with rankings based on the data by IFI Claims Patent Service.
item.creator: Prableen Bajpai

item.title: Inside Samsung Asset Management’s Metaverse Play
item.description: As a pioneer in the market, Samsung Asset Management introduced the first actively managed local metaverse-themed ETF in November 2021. Now, it has followed up with the launch of the first ETF that tracks U.S.-listed and U.S.-domiciled companies involved in the metaverse theme.
item.creator: MarketInsite

item.title: Want to Disrupt Your Industry?  Start with a Culture of Innovation
item.description: We love stories of disruption. It’s the scrappy newcomer appearing to unseat the big incumbent player, and we all like to cheer for an underdog. But disruption isn't necessarily about fighting harder or beating them at their own game. Disruption is about opportunity.
item.creator: Guest Contributors

item.title: How Amplitude’s Transformative Tech Makes It Easy for Companies to Drive Success
item.description: As a top-ranked product analytics solution, Amplitude is on a mission to make analytics easy to understand with effective tools to help companies drive success on their digital platforms.
item.creator: MarketInsite

item.title: Rivian Raises $12 Billion in Record-breaking IPO
item.description: On Wednesday, Rivian (RIVN), an innovative automotive technology company, listed on Nasdaq, raising $12 billion and setting the record for the largest initial public offering (IPO) in the United States in 2021 and the 7th largest IPO in the U.S. to date.
item.creator: MarketInsite

item.title: Why Customer-Led Innovation is the Future of Business
item.description: There was a time when companies would stick around for decades. They had a great product, steady revenue, brand recognition and growth — a great Fortune 500 candidate.
item.creator: Guest Contributors

item.description: The past few years have certainly emphasized the importance of health, both mental and physical, and on the diverse attitudes and economics of healthcare around the world.
item.creator: Chris Versace

item.title: From a Dorm Room to a Virtual IPO: How ZoomInfo Went Public Amid a Pandemic
item.description: Even amid a global pandemic, ZoomInfo, saw the opportunity to go public, and its IPO in June of 2020 “cracked open the IPO market,” according to Jeff Thomas, head of Western U.S. Listings and Capital Markets at Nasdaq.
item.creator: MarketInsite

item.title: Valkyrie Lists Bitcoin Futures ETF on Nasdaq
item.description: Valkyrie Funds has become the first asset manager to create a bitcoin futures exchange-traded fund (ETF) on the Nasdaq Exchange, listing the Valkyrie Bitcoin Strategy Fund (BTF) on Friday, Oct. 22.
item.creator: MarketInsite

item.title: Why Innovative Companies Need IP-Moats
item.description: We live in an era where the economy is driven by innovation. Companies are continuously iterating on ideas and building innovative products and services. While growing market share is every company's primary focus, gaining competitive advantage through IP-Moat is also critical.
item.creator: Guest Contributors

item.title: World Reimagined: The Future of Data Privacy
item.description: More connected devices mean greater threats to personal data privacy and more opportunities for information to be compromised

item.title: Adena Friedman Named to Fortune’s 2021 List of Most Powerful Women

item.title: Innovating Sports Betting with Capital Markets Surveillance Technology
item.description: Sporttrade and Nasdaq recently announced a new technology partnership, through which Sporttrade will leverage market surveillance technology from Nasdaq. We sat down with Alex Kane, Founder and CEO of Sporttrade, to hear more about the vision behind Sporttrade.

item.title: Building the Partner-Centric Roadmap: Innovating for Partner Success
item.description: Innovation. Ingenuity. Transformation. If you’re a software provider, you are likely familiar with these terms as well the aspirational, and assumed massive change, that often accompanies them. But innovation doesn’t always have to be a heavy lift
item.creator: Guest Contributors

item.title: Australia's Whitehaven Coal cuts output forecast on bad weather
item.description: Whitehaven Coal Ltd on Friday cut its coal production forecast for 2022 after bad weather hit its flagship Maules Creek operation, forcing Australia's biggest independent coal miner to report a 23% slump in second-quarter output.
item.creator: Reuters

item.title: U.S. charges Belarus officials with aircraft piracy over diverted Ryanair flight
item.description: The U.S. Department of Justice said on Thursday it has charged four Belarusian government officials with aircraft piracy for diverting a Ryanair flight last May to arrest a dissident Belarusian journalist who was on board.
item.creator: Reuters

item.title: Mexico's Banorte posts jump in quarterly net profit; expects 2022 growth
item.description: Mexico's Grupo Financiero Banorte on Thursday said it expected to boost its net income in 2022 by as much as 17.3%, and posted higher net income and revenue in the fourth quarter of 2021 compared with the year-ago period.

item.title: Why Shares of Adagio Therapeutics Soared 25.9% on Thursday
item.description:
What happened
Shares of Adagio Therapeutics (NASDAQ: ADGI) jumped 25.9% on Thursday. The stock closed at $5.55 a share on Wednesday, opened at $5.62 on Thursday, and hit a midday high of $6.99 before closing at $6.44.
